meta.description:
TLD: SE
Script Identifier: ISO 15924 Latn
Script Description: Latin
Version: 1.0
Effective Date: 12 January 2009
     Registry: .SE (Stiftelsen för Internetinfrastruktur)
Contact: Anne-Marie Eklund-Löwinder Anne-Marie.Eklund-Lowinder@iis.se
Address: Box 7399, SE-10391 Stockholm, Sweden
Telephone: +46 8 452 3500 Fax: +46 8 452 3502
Website: http://www.iis.se/

Relevant Policy Document URL: http://www.iis.se/pdf/allmanna_villkor_eng.pdf

This document describes the script table used by the .SE registry for the registration of domain names in all the languages with official status in Sweden that are written with the Latin script, plus additional characters in that script as specified in guidelines issued by the Swedish government. The table presented here is in compliance with the ICANN Guidelines for the Implementation of Internationalized Domain Names Version 2.1 and is intended for publication in the IANA Repository of TLD IDN Practices, for the information of prospective holders of domains in .SE and for the users of resources within those domains. It subsumes a previously posted description of the character repertoire necessary for Swedish language labels, suggested for use on all levels in other DNS registries. However, the present document does not retain the language-specific information and the earlier table is therefore being kept in the IANA Repository.

The material presented here was initially prepared by the .MUSEUM registry, which is posting it simultaneously in the IANA Repository. A detailed explanation of the derivation of the table and the policies attaching to its use is located at http://about.museum/idn/museum-se-latin.pdf.

Characters are listed in this table with their Unicode code points in U+xxxx format. The Unicode name for each character appears to the right of the number sign "#" on the same line. A label that contains a LATIN LETTER may not contain a letter or equivalent character from any other script, unless explicitly permitted in the IDN character table for a language written with that script. No prescriptive policies are attached to what in a language-specific context might be seen as character variants, and the registration of a label containing any of the listed characters confers no rights to any other orthographically comparable form. Restrictions apply to the positions in which the U+002D HYPHEN-MINUS may appear.
